summary: This is an internal FBI memo documenting a call between FBI personnel and Peter Brill regarding a potential defense witness in the Epstein case. The conversation concerns the relevance of a witness, possibly named 'Rohrbach', and discusses testimony from a victim about a third party being present for sex acts after the victim was of age.

persons.name: Peter Brill
persons.role: Unknown (likely law enforcement or legal professional contacted by FBI)
persons.context: Was called by the FBI agent regarding a potential defense witness; asked for defense counsel's contact information and was informed about the nature of a previous conversation.

persons.name: Andrew Rohrbach
persons.role: FBI personnel (US Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
persons.context: Author or recipient of the internal note; the conversation with Peter Brill references a prior conversation involving Rohrbach.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.role: FBI personnel (US Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
persons.context: Recipient of the internal note documenting the call with Peter Brill.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to whether he engaged in sexual activity with a potential witness; central figure in the case.

connections.description: Rohrbach (or the FBI agent) spoke with Brill on the phone regarding a defense witness and shared information about a prior conversation.
Rohrbach sent an internal note to Byrne documenting the call with Peter Brill.

events.title: FBI call with Peter Brill regarding defense witness
events.description: FBI personnel called Peter Brill to discuss a potential defense witness, informed him of a prior conversation, and discussed the relevance of the witness based on victim testimony.

keyFacts: The document records an FBI call on December 14, 2021, with Peter Brill about a potential defense witness in the Epstein case.

A victim at trial testified that someone (possibly the witness in question) was present for sex acts after the victim was over the age of consent, but the victim did not say that person engaged in the acts.
The FBI expressed interest in speaking with the potential witness if she remains on the defense witness list.
The document indicates ongoing investigative activity and witness coordination years after Epstein's death.
